model

Class MainModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.MainModel

  • public class MainModel
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main model for the whole application. It includes critical methods for calculating the scores, scheduling execitions and acts as a bridge between the RESTAPI resources and the database.
    Author:
    d_mit

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.util.ArrayList<Club> clubs
      A public list of all the clubs used by the application

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      MainModel()
      The constructor first initialises a connection with both the remote database and the football data API.

    • Field Detail

      • clubs

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Club> clubs
        A public list of all the clubs used by the application

    • Constructor Detail

      • MainModel

        public MainModel()
        The constructor first initialises a connection with both the remote database and the football data API. It then loads all the data from the backend that is unchanged by the application including clubs, players and fixtures. Another initialisation method is then called and then both the scheduled exection services are started.

    • Method Detail

      • initialise

        public void initialise()
        This is an initialisation method that is first called when the application is started and then called again each time one of the scheduled executions commenences.

        It first determines the two dates the scheduled executors should next execute and then loads and refreshes user and league data from the database, incase new users and leagues have been created.

      • isGameOver

        public void isGameOver()
        This method is used to terminate the whole application. It is called at the start of every round.

        It acts as a placeholder to a more intuative end game solution that aims to display a final screen of results rather than terminate the whole application.

      • scheduleUpdate

        public void scheduleUpdate()
        This method is called at the end of a round to build the scores for each player, team and store each score along with the fixtures played, into the database. It also re-enables transfer activity and team managment functionaility.

        This method is adapted from https://stackoverflow.com/a/54050020

      • scheduleBlock

        public void scheduleBlock()
        This method is called at the start of a round to firstly check if the whole game was over and then to disable transfer and team managment activity while the round is in progress.

        This method is adapted from https://stackoverflow.com/a/54050020

      • writePreviousFixtures

        public void writePreviousFixtures()
        This is the main score builidng method. It stores the previous fixtures played, calls helper methods to build individual score cards for each of the players in each fixture and caluculate a points tally based on that scorecard, then it stores the score cards and player scores in the database also.

      • buildScoresForFixture

        public java.util.ArrayList<Score> buildScoresForFixture(com.github.pabloo99.xmlsoccer.api.dto.GetHistoricMatchesResultDto fixture)
        Helper method used for building all the individual score cards for each player that appears in a fixture.

        The method first makes a call to the football data api to get the full list of players in the lineup and match event data for the fixture. The method then uses the lineup data to see who started in a fixture, and then iterates through each of the match events for each player that started, counting each of the events the player was involved in. The same process is repeated for the benched players.

        Unfortunately due to an error with the returned API data, a hard coded solution had to be implemented to stop a String mismatch. The API returns two different versions of the same persons name.

        Parameters:
        fixture - a fixture object returned by the api
        Returns:
        a list of all the scores for the fixture

      • calculateCleanSheet

        public int calculateCleanSheet(com.github.pabloo99.xmlsoccer.api.dto.GetHistoricMatchesResultDto fixture,
                               com.github.pabloo99.xmlsoccer.api.dto.GetMatchLineupsDto participant)
        This is a helper method used in the score building process to calculate if a player recieved a clean sheet in a fixture.

        This is when the team has no goals scored against them.

        Parameters:
        fixture - a fixture object from the football api
        participant - a player object from the api
        Returns:
        an integer indicating if a clean sheet occured or not

      • calculateConcedeTwo

        public int calculateConcedeTwo(com.github.pabloo99.xmlsoccer.api.dto.GetHistoricMatchesResultDto fixture,
                               com.github.pabloo99.xmlsoccer.api.dto.GetMatchLineupsDto participant)
        This is a helper method used in the score building process to calculate if a player conceded more than two goals.
        Parameters:
        fixture - a fixture object from the football api
        participant - a player object from the api
        Returns:
        an integer indicating if more than two goals were conceded

      • calculatePointsFrom

        public int calculatePointsFrom(Score score)
        This is a helper method used for calculating a points tally for a given score of a player.

        The method uses predefined enum constants to return integer values based off of the different recorded match events and the player's position.

        Parameters:
        score - a score card recording the different match events a player was involved in during a fixture
        Returns:
        an integer points total calculated from the score

      • writeTeamScores

        public void writeTeamScores()
        This is the second and last score builidng method that compliles all the individual player scores from the database, builds and stores a team score aswell as initialising each of the teams for the next round and updating scores and rankings in the leagues.

      • registerUser

        public void registerUser(java.lang.String email,
                         java.lang.String pass)
        This acts as a bridging method between the RESTAPI and the database. It is called when a user first registers an account with the application.
        Parameters:
        email - validated email string
        pass - unencrypted string

      • registerTeam

        public void registerTeam(java.lang.String name,
                         java.util.UUID id)
        This acts as a bridging method between the RESTAPI and the database. It is called when a user registers a team for the first time with the application.

        It calls three seperate methods that store each of the related data about the team into the database.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the team
        id - the uuid of the user

      • addPlayerToTeam

        public java.lang.String addPlayerToTeam(java.util.UUID id,
                                        int position,
                                        java.util.UUID user_id)
        This method is called when a user is creating a team and adds a player into the model.
        Parameters:
        id - uuid of the team
        position - integer indicating the position in the team
        user_id - uuid of the user
        Returns:
        a string message indicating success or error

                                          int position,
                                          java.util.UUID user_id)

        Parameters:
        id - uuid of the team
        position - integer indicating the position in the team
        user_id - uuid of the user
        Returns:

        Returns:

      • manageTeam

        public void manageTeam(java.util.UUID id)
        This method is called when the user has confirmed they want to make changes when managing their team.

        The database is updated with the changes to the team and players positions in the team.

        Parameters:
        id - the uuid of the user

      • updateTeam

        public void updateTeam(java.util.UUID id)
        This method is called when the user has confirmed they want to make changes when making transfers to the team.

        The database is updated with the changes to the team and players' positions in the team.

        Parameters:
        id - the uuid of the user

      • getPointHistory

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>> getPointHistory(java.util.UUID team_id)
        This method when called, runs an instance of the history thread amd returns the generated HashMap of the point history for a team.

        The point history building was refactored to run as a thread in an attempt to stop request timeouts when the app was deployed.

        Parameters:
        team_id - the uuid of the team
        Returns:
        a HashMap of the point history of the team

      • authenticateUser

        public java.util.UUID authenticateUser(java.lang.String email,
                                       java.lang.String pass)
        This method is called when a user attempts to login. It acts as a bridge between the database and the RESTAPI resources.

        When a new user logs in, it adds the user object to an arraylist of all users in the application. If an existing user logs in, it removes the instance of the user in the list and re-adds it.

        Parameters:
        email - the email string entered by the user
        pass - the password entered by the user
        Returns:
        the uuid of the user

      • loadTeam

        public void loadTeam(java.util.UUID user_id)
        This method is called when a user has successfully logged in. It searches the database for the associated team of a user, using the user's uuid.

        Once the team has been found it is set as an attribute of the user.

        Parameters:
        user_id - the uuid of the user

      • isTransferOn

        public boolean isTransferOn(java.util.UUID team_id)
        This method is called when a user attempts to access the transferScreen. It checks the database to see if the team is permitted to make transfer activity. It will return false if transfers are not premitted and true if they are.
        Parameters:
        team_id - uuid of the team
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if transfers are allowed or not

      • doesUserExist

        public boolean doesUserExist(java.lang.String email)
        This method is called when a user is registering a new account. Before a new account is stored, this check is called to make sure a user is not already registed with the same email address.
        Parameters:
        email - the email string entered by the user
        Returns:
        boolean indicating wether a user is already registered on the database

      • doesTeamExist

        public boolean doesTeamExist(java.lang.String email)
        This method is called when a user logs in. It checks the database to see if the user has finished the team creation process and decide what view to direct the user to.
        Parameters:
        email - the email string entered by the user
        Returns:
        boolean indicating wether a team has been created for a user

      • getRankIn

        public int getRankIn(java.util.UUID league_id,
                     java.util.UUID team_id)

        Called when a user enters the home screen.

        Parameters:
        league_id - uuid of the public league
        team_id - uuid of the team
        Returns:
        the integer position of the team in the public league

      • getTodayDate

        public static java.time.LocalDateTime getTodayDate()
        Returns the local date time the application is running on.

        Since this is a simualtion of the 19/20 season, it is set back by 1 year.

        Returns:
        the date and time (minus 1 year)

      • setCaptain

        public void setCaptain(java.util.UUID user_id,
                       int position)
        This method is called when a user wants to manage their team and selects a new captain.
        Parameters:
        user_id - uuid of the user who wants to manage their captain
        position - integer indicating the position of the player in the team selected to be captain

      • setTransfer

        public void setTransfer(java.util.UUID team_id,
                        boolean transfer)
        This method is called when a user has made a transfer before a round starts.

        It sets the transfer boolean of the team in the database to false so no more transfer ativity ccan occur before the next round.

        Parameters:
        team_id - uuid of the team
        transfer - boolean indicating if transfers are permitted or not

      • setTransferAll

        public void setTransferAll(boolean transfer)
        This method is called during a schedule update after a round has finished.

        It sets all of the teams' transfer boolean to true so that every team can make transfers for the next round.

        Parameters:
        transfer -
